Collections N Copies

The role of Collections.nCopies() is to return an immutable list (CopiesList) which contains n copies of given object.

Throws IllegalArgumentException if value of number is less than 0.

Sample Program:

            import java.math.BigInteger;
            import java.util.Collections;
            import java.util.List;

            public class NCopies {
                public static void main(String[] args) {
                    int n = 3;
                    Object obj ="Java";
                    List ncopiesList = Collections.nCopies(n, obj);
                    System.out.println(ncopiesList);
                }
            }

Output:

            [Java, Java, Java]
